intro: Acianthera portilloi, commonly known as the Portillo's orchid, is a rare and delicate orchid species native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces intricate inflorescences. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
